text:
Just wondering if anyone can point me in the right direction in regards to logging total cleared profit for each strategy once market/orders are cleared.

I currently log cleared orders via _process_cleared_orders_meta() and market profit via _process_cleared_markets(), but would like to add total profit for each strategy.

I can just process the cleared orders in a dataframe and groupby sum profit based on strat name, but I am hoping there is a more Flumine way to tackle this.

Have retrieved cleared orders from betfair via "client.betting_client.betting.list_cleared_orders()" to sum based on strategy name, but strategy refs have been recorded as my device name. So it appears only Flumine knows which orders belong to each strategy.

elements.text:

I currently log cleared orders via _process_cleared_orders_meta() and market profit via _process_cleared_markets(), but would like to add total profit for each strategy.

text: What is the goal here? If you are already recording all of the order data, just log the final profit then? Or have I misunderstood?

elements.text: What is the goal here? If you are already recording all of the order data, just log the final profit then? Or have I misunderstood?

text: I'm wanting to log cleared profit for each strategy, I have a backtest logging control set for the client which logs net cleared market profit but would like breakdown of net profit for each strategy. Does the blotter get updated once orders are cleared? In the _process_cleared_markets() function can I just call orders from blotter and get profit per strat?

elements.text: I'm wanting to log cleared profit for each strategy, I have a backtest logging control set for the client which logs net cleared market profit but would like breakdown of net profit for each strategy. Does the blotter get updated once orders are cleared? In the _process_cleared_markets() function can I just call orders from blotter and get profit per strat?
